election_record.label: Maine 1821 Governor

overview.note: "For the office of Chief Magistrate, two Candidates only are in regular nomination, the Hon. ALBION K. PARRIS, and Gen. JOSHUA WINGATE, Jr. both of them denominated republicans; but between the partizans of each, there has, and still exists, a warfar, unprecedented for its rancour, malevolence, and personality." Boston Commercial Gazette (Boston, MA). September 6, 1821.

"The Hon. EZEKIEL WHITMAN, is put in nomination, in the Portland Gazette for Governor, at the approaching Election in Maine. It is not expected that he will succeed in the election; but the federalists have at length thought, that it was better to start a candidate of their own, than to rest on their arms." Boston Commercial Gazette (Boston, MA). September 6, 1821.
Joshua Wingate, Jr. received 246 votes as Joshua Wingate.
